pageContext.description:
Christ stands in the centre of this rectangular composition shifted to the left of the central axis and surrounded by a crowd of mothers with their children. He holds one of the children in his arms and has placed his hand over another's stomach. The mothers press in on him from either side. The apostles are visible in the top left corner and their defensive stance betrays their scepticism.
[Görres, cda 2017]

metadata.title: Christ blessing the children

pageContext.provenance:
- the Ulveldt family, Vienna, before 1768
- sent as a present by the last male member of the family, the grand chancellor Leo Ulveldt to his relative, Baron Hakvin Stiernblad of Torup, Sweden
- by descent (the picture was sold by the family in 1932 but subsequently bought back) until Baron Stiernblad, Sweden
- Christie's, London, 23 March 1973, lot 33
- Anonymous sale
- Sotheby's, London, 11 December 1985, lot 26
- Acquired by private owner in the 1980s
- Christie's, London, 4 Dec 2012, lot 3
[Christie's Online Database, http://www.christies.com/lotfinder/paintings/lucas-cranach-i-suffer-the-little-children-5639255-details.aspx?from=searchresults&intObjectID=5639255&sid=2c667680-ea34-4d68-bdf5-96e504b1186f, accessed 10 Oct 2017]
pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia and date at the top centre: serpent with dropped wings and dated '1538'
[cda 2017]

titles.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
